intro: Maytenus annobonensis, commonly known as the Annobon Island mayten, is a small evergreen tree native to the island of Annobón in the Gulf of Guinea. It belongs to the family Celastraceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in axillary inflorescences, followed by small, fleshy berries. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is adapted to the tropical climate of its native habitat.
